abilitygroupdescription.p: Represents general physical abilities and common non-weapon-specific fighting abilities, including boxing, wrestling and other bare handed martial arts.

abilitydescription.p: ability:armour Armour Check After the character gets attacked they make an armour check to see if that attack was successfully defeated by the characters armour. If successful the character takes no damage from the attack. This can be interpreted as either the armour taking the force of the blow and protecting the character, or the character moving in such a way that the the character is struck a glancing blow leaving them uninjured.

Instead of making an armour check the character may choose to dodge, shield block, parry or use some other attack-reaction ability. Armour is not a reaction and does not use the characters reaction for the current turn unlike many other defence check abilities.

To make an Armour Check the modifier is calculated as follows. First calculate the bonus for the type of armour worn by the character, Plate provides +4, No armour provides +0. The Armour Modifier is then the Armour Rank of this ability, plus the Armour Bonus, +1 if a shieldis used, minus three.

If the armour result fails and a boon is rolled the attack deals half damage. If the armour result fails and a bane is rolled the attack deals double damage. If the armour check succeeds the attack does no damage. If it fails the attack does normal damage.
Some attacks cannot be defended with armour, a dragons breath weapon. If no other attack-reaction ability is used the attack automatically does normal damage.

The Charge ability allows the character to test their mettle. If sucessful they may move their movement rate +1d6 in the direction of an enemy and then make an additional melee attack. A character cannot Charge an enemy who is within their movement range as there is not enough distance to build up speed, (in that case they should just move and attack). If the character fails to reach their attacker then they must move at their full movement plus extra charge moment towards their foe and finish their turn in the open without attacking.

Attacks made with this ability gain the Charge tag and any rules that apply to such tags, such as Brace for Charge, can be used against the Charger. Charging may provoke a break test in opponents at the GM's discretion. On overcharge the character becomes Enraged.
This ability represents the characters ability to Climb.

ability:dodge The character may attempt to dodge instead of making an armour roll. Doing so uses the characters reaction for the round. If successful the attack is dodged and the character takes no damage. If the dodge fails and a bane is rolled the attack does double damage. If the dodge fails and a boon is rolled the attack does half damage.

Some types of attack cannot be dodged, e.g. surprise attacks or poisonous gas attacks. Other types of attack the acid or fire attacks of dragons may be dodgeable depending on the context and deal half or no damage (at the GM's discretion).

The Flee ability allows the character to move more than twice their movement rate away from an enemy, fear has given them wings. Characters who are fleeing must make a Rally check in the End Stage to stop fleeing. Characters may voluntarily flee if there exists a credible threat, or they may be forced to flee if they fail a break test. For the purposes of game play fleeing is considered to be a double movement +d6. Fleeing is successful if the character is not damaged in the following round. Fleeing does not trigger an attack of opportunity.

Grappling involves grabbing, tackling or wrestling an opponent and holding them without harming them. Other attacks against a grappled opponent are hindered by the grappler being close to the opponent and the opponents struggling.

Every round that an opponent is grappled they may make an opposed Str test against their grappler to escape. Once grappled it takes a round for a second character to tie-up, or otherwise constrain, the opponent.

A head butt involves the attacker driving the top of their head into the bridge of the defenders nose. Head butting is mainly used as an attack of last resort or as a surprise attack. An attacker may only head butt someone immediately in front or behind them. An character may head butt when grappled.
Head butts do +1 damage if the attacker is wearing a helmet and -1 damage if the defender is wearing a helmet.
This ability represents the characters ability to Jump.
The attacker uses his mass and strength to brush aside those who stand in his way. Such is the force of his unstoppable charge that at most one opportunity attack can be made against him.
Note that the Juggernaut ability may only be used against opponents of similar or smaller size and strength.

Knockout After a character reduces an opponents hit points to zero the character may make an attempt to knock the opponent out instead of killing them. The opponent must be humanoid and of the same size as the attacker or smaller. If the character succeeds in their Knockout Check the opponent becomes Unconscious. If the check fails then the opponent is killed. Note that Lethal and Nonlethal tagged weapons modify this check.
The attacker kicks an opponent potentially pushing the opponent back at higher ranks. The opponent must be approximately the same sized or smaller as the attacker in order to be pushed.
A successful kick at rank 3 and above pushes the defender back (provided the defender is the same size as the attacker or smaller).
This is the characters ability to hear faint noise. Hear Noisesee Listen
This ability represents the characters attention to detail, alertness, and their ability to notice subtle things in urban environments that are not as they should be.
Detect Trapssee Notice (Urban) Trapssee Notice (Urban) This ability is used to detect traps. In the wilderness use the Scout ability and use a Perception Check elsewhere.
The attacker attempts to hit their opponent using their fists. Does +2 damage if the attacker is wearing gauntlets, -2 damage if the attacker is wearing a helmet.

HealingRest The character takes a moment to catch their breath and collect themselves. This takes five to ten minutes. Given time the character succeeds automatically. If the character only has a few minutes to rest or they are interupted then they must check to see if they are successful.
Characters only benefit from up to two Rests between Sleeps.

The Run ability describes extra movement within combat. It allows the character to move twice their movement rate during combat or pursuit. This ability automatically succeeds if the character is not incapacicated in some way.

In addition, the character may make a check to go for it, and move a bit further in addition to their double move. This ability represents the characters fleet footedness. During combat this is represented by moving an extra 1-3 squares when playing on a grid, or some other narrative effect during TOTM combat. If the character fails their check they need to make an Agility check or suffer a bane.
During a pursuit the character increases their rank by two if they fail and three if they succeed.

HealingSleep The character sleeps for six or more hours. If the characters sleep is uninterrupted then no check is required. If the characters are attacked or disturbed they may need to make a check to see whether they are fully rested.
If the character sleeps then they receive two refreshes, if they are required to check and they fail then they only receive one refresh.
When the attacker would be knocked prone they can check to resist being knocked over.

This ability represents the characters ability to swim (if at all). Everyone is assumed to be able to dog paddle instinctively. Failure of this check means that the character is unable to make any progress. Repeated failures might result in the characters having to make exhaustion or resolve checks as they start to panic.

This character attempts to thrown something. If unsuccessful, and a bane occurs and they are under some form of pressure the character drops the item at their feet. Otherwise unsuccessful throws scatter one random square five times. If sucessful the throw is accurate.

When the characters hit points drop to 0 they can instantly make a Retribution check and if successful the character may immediately perform a Charge or an Attack. If a Charge is performed no roll for successfully charging is required. Default weapon damage is tripled.
In the event of an overcharge the character gains the Unconscious condition at the end of their action.
